H0.text: Tree rings indicate the environmental conditions at the time of their creation, along with ice cores and varves.

H1.text: Mountain ranges indicate the environmental conditions at the time of their creation, alongside ice cores and varves.

H2.text: Fossils indicate the environmental conditions at the time of their creation, together with ice cores and varves.

H3.text: Magma indicates the environmental conditions at the time of its creation, just as ice cores and varves do.

A4.text: Tree rings can be used in dendrochronology to indicate years that are colder than usual.

A5.text: Similar seasonal patterns also occur in ice cores and in varves (layers of sediment deposition in a lake, river, or sea bed).
